TEXT: The applicant [ Mr ORG ] is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives at PERSON ( GPE ) . He is a soldier in the provisional reserve force .
The facts of the case , as presented by the applicant , may be summarised as follows .

On DATE the applicant signed an “ administrative special - quarters - allocation form ” at the ORG Quartermaster - General , thereby obtaining the use of lodgings in GPE . The quartermasters - general were set up by a royal decree of CARDINAL DATE to meet the housing needs of military personnel , who were liable to be transferred at regular intervals .

In DATE the applicant made a request under PERSON no . CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE for a transfer to the provisional reserve force . It was granted by a decree ( no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) issued by ORG on DATE . The transfer was irreversible under administrative regulations .

On DATE Royal Decree no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL of DATE was published . It established ORG ( GPE ) and abolished the ORG Quartermaster - General . By DATE ( see “ Relevant domestic law ” below ) , certain servicemen in the provisional reserve force were required to surrender possession of DATE to the ORG before DATE .

On DATE the Director - General of GPE informed the applicant that DATE should have been vacated before DATE . On DATE the applicant was given DATE to leave and was told that failure to do so would result in possession proceedings being brought . GPE put in motion an administrative procedure against the applicant , who on DATE was ordered to leave DATE by a decision of the Secretary of ORG .
On DATE the applicant made an application to ORG for judicial review of that decision .

Meanwhile , GPE sought an order from the GPE investigating judge requiring the applicant to vacate the LOC ( ORG had not ordered a stay of execution of the decision of DATE ) . On DATE the investigating judge made an order authorising eviction .

The applicant lodged an appeal with ORG , which reversed the impugned decision on DATE holding that the execution of the administrative eviction order was disproportionate since the application for judicial review was still pending .

The DATE decree was partly amended by LAW no . CARDINAL of DATE , which was not , however , applicable to servicemen in the provisional reserve force . Nonetheless , it did permit aggrieved parties to apply in certain circumstances for a stay of execution of orders for possession . The applicant made such an application on DATE . However , owing to the fact that he had moved , it was not heard .

In a judgment of DATE , which was served on DATE , ORG dismissed the applicant ’s application for judicial review and upheld the order for possession . It noted at the outset that the applicant had been allocated his quarters in his capacity as a serviceman and that public servants were in an objective legal position that could be modified without undermining the rule of law . A public servant ’s position was therefore not immutable from the time he took up office , but was governed by the principle that the rules regulating the status of public servants had been accepted . In rejecting the applicant ’s submissions , the court referred to a ORG judgment of DATE in which it was held that the law on urban lettings and the provisions governing low - rent housing did not apply to military quarters or to transfers of possession of DATE . The applicant ’s claims were therefore ill - founded since none of the rights the applicant might previously have enjoyed as a tenant had been infringed ; nor had he been unlawfully deprived of his legitimate rights .

The applicant subsequently lodged an amparo appeal with ORG , which was dismissed in a decision of DATE on the ground that there was no constitutional basis for the appeal . ORG held that the court below had given sufficient reasons for rejecting the applicant ’s submissions regarding the retrospective application of Decree no . DATE ( see “ Relevant domestic law ” below ) . It further noted that eviction from DATE did not amount to a penalty for the purposes of LAW and that , in any event , no amparo appeal lay in respect of breaches of that provision , in which the prohibition on giving retrospective effect to norms that were restrictive of rights was to be found .

“ The LAW guarantees the rule of law , the application of norms according to rank , their publication , the non - retrospective nature of provisions laying down increased penalties or restricting individual rights , legal certainty , the accountability of public authorities and the prohibition of any arbitrary act on their part . ”

“ In the light of the need for military defence planning and in order to enhance the operational effectiveness of ORG and facilitate the geographical mobility of their members , ORG shall take appropriate measures to provide for the housing needs of members of ORG resulting from the requirement for them to be mobile ; ... ”

“ CARDINAL(a ) Servicemen in the provisional reserve force when LAW enters into force [ DATE ] and occupying military quarters shall be entitled to live in DATE for life provided they satisfy the age requirement for joining the reserve force for their rank , regiment and post as laid down by Law no . CARDINAL of DATE or will satisfy that requirement within a maximum of DATE .
All other members of the provisional reserve force shall vacate DATE before DATE . ”
